subject: Re: [junit] How to test servlet
msgSnippet: ... I use JMock, although I have used EasyMock. The general approach is this: 1. Create a fake/stub HttpServletRequest and set its parameters and session
messageBody:
mahesh_junit wrote:
> hi
>
> How we can test servlet that talks to a DAO and connect to the
> database and output the Values retrieved Using Mock Approach.
>
> Which mock framework would be Best? like Mock Objects,DynaMock ,EasyMock

I use JMock, although I have used EasyMock. The general approach is this:

1. Create a fake/stub HttpServletRequest and set its parameters and
session information as needed.

2. Create a mock HttpServletResponse if your servlet writes to it.

3. Inject fake or mock DAO, database and so on into the servlet.

4. Invoke service().

You can find more examples in _JUnit Recipes_, in the chapter on testing
web components.
